avalancheActivity.highlights: Little snow is in the area and generally considered stable.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Not much snow is in the area. During the week, snow in mountains was considered mostly stable after freeze/thaw cycles. It subsided and settled further in a warm spell on Thursday 20.11. and should stiffen and gain more strength when it freezes.

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow is generally stiff, mostly homogeneous and  stable after thaw followed by freezing.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snow is generally stiff, mostly homogeneous and stable after thaw followed by freezing.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hægviðri og stöku él. Kólnar smám saman, frystir á láglendi á laugardagskvöld.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow is generally considered stable after a warm spell followed by freezing.

snowpackStructure.highlights: In the warm spell on Thursday 20.11., snow subsided, settled and gained strength. It should stiffen and stabilize further with freezing temperatures. Little snow is at lower elevations.

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow is generally stiff, mostly homogeneous and  stable after thaw followed by freezing.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snow is generally stiff, mostly homogeneous and stable after thaw followed by freezing.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hægviðri og stöku él. Kólnar smám saman, frystir á láglendi á laugardagskvöld.

avalancheActivity.highlights: The snowpack is generally considered stable and is expected to strengthen further with cooling weather from Saturday.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow in the mountains has become wet following the recent thaw across the country, but is generally considered stable.  A period of stable but cooling weather is expected over the next few days, which will promote refreezing and further strengthen the snowpack.

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow is generally stiff, mostly homogeneous and  stable after thaw followed by freezing.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snow is generally stiff, mostly homogeneous and stable after thaw followed by freezing.

weatherForecast.highlights: Rólegt veður næstu daga en fer kólnandi. Hæð yfir landinu frá laugardegi til mánudags.

avalancheActivity.comment: A small avalanche fell in Skeiðfell north of the road Norðfjarðarvegur. South facing gully, probably released on Saturday 15.11.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow is generally considered stable after thaw followed by freezing. Small, unstable wind slabs may though be present in isolated places at high elevations, in gullies and below ridgelines, mainly on south-facing aspects.

snowpackStructure.highlights: During the week the snow was generally stable, but isolated layered wind slabs were in south facing slopes. In warm weather on Thursday night 20-21. November, the snow settled, got moist and more homogeneous. With freezing, the snow should stiffen and strengthen further. At high elevations, were the thaw had less effect, isolated unstable wind slabs can though still exist, especially in gullies and depressions facing south.

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow is generally stiff, mostly homogeneous and  stable after thaw followed by freezing.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snow is generally stiff, mostly homogeneous and stable after thaw followed by freezing.
